sub-title: A small library for react with variety of ui components.
txt-instalation: To install the library you will need to run the following command.
txt-requisites: For this library you need to have a react project generated by vite. You can check the documentation on the vite page.
txt-import: Once the library is installed, you can import the module as follows:
components-txt: With the library installed we will have access to these components:
dev-route: In the development route, it is planned to implement more components that are being developed, such as any of the following:
txt-modal: To use this component we must import this package
txt-modal-btn: In this case we will have to create a function to open the modal:
simple-props-modal: These are the minimum props that the component needs to function.
modal-extra-props: If you add a confirmation function and pass the confirm={true} prop to the modal, it will become a confirmation window.
dir-modal: The direction accessory supports 4 types, down, up, left, right, which will make the modal appear on that side.
txt-tooltip: In this case we will have to wrap the specific element with the tooltip component.
tooltip-props: This component accepts two props, text for the text to display, and direction for the position of the tooltip(top/bottom).
txt-drag: These are the minimum props that the component needs.
props-drag: We can specify the document type for , .pdf, word, excel , .odt or .txt .With the image type it allows the loading of jpeg, png, gif, webp and svg+xml
props-drag-multi: With the multiple prop we can upload several files at the same time.
import-drag: To use this component we must import this package and declare a setFile function.
